author: Staff Reporter
text:
Two Corporation workers, who were among the 20 persons on an indefinite fast near the Corporation office, were hospitalised on Monday after they developed health problems.

A section of overhead water operators, conservancy workers and drivers, who were merged into the Corporation staff core from eight panchayats and two municipalities, were on a fast for the fourth day on Monday asking for parity in wages with the workers on the same rank who had been with the Corporation before the merger.

Those hospitalised were M. Ponnusamy (47) and A. Velakanni (45), overhead water tank operators.

Around 200 workers, who were absorbed as Corporation staff by the government about four years ago following the merger, were still given consolidated monthly pay ranging from Rs. 2,000 to Rs. 4,000. This prompted them to go on fasting.
title: Two workers on fast hospitalised
